item.title: Windows Server Configuration
item.description:
Ensuring that all services are up and operating without any disruptions is crucial in a data centre setting.

If you are utilising a DHCP server, it is crucial to ensure that you do not have duplicate IP addresses or IP conflicts, especially in server environments, as this will disrupt your vital services.

How can IP conflicts be avoided?

  1. Keeping an eye on the distribution of IP addresses
  2. Preserving an IPAM system in real time
  3. Setting up static IP addresses on important servers that are not covered by DHCP or using DHCP IP reservations.

It can take days to find and fix duplicate IP addresses, which makes problem solving difficult at times.
